article_title: CVS, Walgreens Illegally Charged Women For Birth Control
article_text:

article_metadata.description: CVS and Walgreens are under fire for illegally charging 11,000 women a co-pay for their birth control prescriptions at their pharmacies. Under the Affordable

og.description: CVS and Walgreens are under fire for illegally charging 11,000 women a co-pay for their birth control prescriptions at their pharmacies. Under the Affordable Care Act, forms of preventative care — including generic contraception — does not require a co-pay. Thousands of women are now going to be reimbursed.  "The Simpsons"/"Family Guy" crossover episode had a rape joke in it.  Marlene Pinnock, the 51-year-old Black woman who was repeatedly punched by a California Highway Patrol officer in July, is receiving a $1.5 million settlement. The officer who beat her has been forced to resign.  A fifth Planned Parenthood clinic providing affordable reproductive healthcare for women in Wisconsin closed today following state budget cuts.  A new report from the NAACP Legal Action Defense Fund and the National Women's Law Center looks at the barriers to educational success for Black girls.  Check out this new documentary "Born To Fly" about queer choreographer and experimental dancer Elizabeth

twitter.description: CVS and Walgreens are under fire for illegally charging 11,000 women a co-pay for their birth control prescriptions at their pharmacies. Under the Affordable Care Act, forms of preventative care — including generic contraception — does not require a co-pay. Thousands of women are now going to be reimbursed.  "The Simpsons"/"Family Guy" crossover episode had a rape joke in it.  Marlene Pinnock, the 51-year-old Black woman who was repeatedly punched by a California Highway Patrol officer in July, is receiving a $1.5 million settlement. The officer who beat her has been forced to resign.  A fifth Planned Parenthood clinic providing affordable reproductive healthcare for women in Wisconsin closed today following state budget cuts.  A new report from the NAACP Legal Action Defense Fund and the National Women's Law Center looks at the barriers to educational success for Black girls.
